io.permazen.vaadin

Class ReloadableJObjectContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vaadin.data.util.AbstractContainer
      • com.vaadin.data.util.AbstractInMemoryContainer<I,String,org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin7.BackedItem<T>>
        • org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin7.AbstractSimpleContainer<I,T>
          • org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin7.SimpleKeyedContainer<ObjId,JObject>
            • io.permazen.vaadin.JObjectContainer
              • io.permazen.vaadin.ReloadableJObjectContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Container, Container.Filterable, Container.Indexed, Container.ItemSetChangeNotifier, Container.Ordered, Container.SimpleFilterable, Container.Sortable, Serializable, org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin7.Connectable, org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin7.PropertyExtractor<JObject>, org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin7.SortingPropertyExtractor<JObject>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QueryJObjectContainer, SnapshotJObjectContainer

    public abstract class ReloadableJObjectContainer
extends JObjectContainer
    A JObjectContainer that supports a reload() operation.

    Instances automatically reload() themselves when connect()'ed.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • reload

        public abstract void reload()
        (Re)load this container.

        May have no effect if this instance is not connect()'ed.

      • reloadAfterCommit

        public void reloadAfterCommit()
        Reload this container after the transaction open in the current thread successfully commits.

        Does nothing if the current transaction fails or this instance is not connect()'ed.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no JTransaction associated with the current thread
